text: Bottle. Amber beer with white head. Aromas of caramel, bread, malts. Lightly sweet, no bitterness, average carbonation.
Bottle. Clear amber with an unstable head. Toasty malt aroma. Rich malt, good body, cereal notes, reasonable bitterness. Reasonable malty lager, but taste a little too average.

Appearance: Medium brown, mahogany? Clear. Some off-white head.
Aroma: Toasted, medium malt. Butterscotch?
Taste: Malt, sweetness, toasted. Pretty good.
Bought: Beers of Europe, 500 ml, £2.69
Info: 23/3-2017, BB: 5/10-2017
50cl bottle from Westholme Stores, Goring. An amber coloured pour with a thick cream head; caramel aroma; soft caramel taste with a light bitterness. Pleasant.

Piwo klarowne w kolorze jasny bursztyn z obfita piana w kolorze miodowym. W aromacie karmel z miodem, troche slodowo zbozowe. W smaku cukierkowa slodycz jakby toffee, orzechy wloskie i karmel. Wysycenie na srednim poziomie, niska i krotka goryczka. Dobrze zbalansowane bez wyczuwalnego alkoholu. Piwo nic nie urywa ale musze przyznac ze nawet mi smakowalo.

Pours clear coppery amber, topped with a decent offwhite head. Nice caramel malty nose with quite some biscuits. Mildly sweet, biscuity with medium bitterness and finishing metallic. Light and quite ruined by the metallic finish.

Aromat: słodowy, karmelowy w kierunku toffi, żelazo, przyjemny, ale trochę nijaki
Wygląd: barwa bursztynowa, delikatne zmętnienie, piana wysoka, beżowa, drobnobańkowa, dosyć trwała, ale nie zdobi szkła
Smak: słodkie, karmelowe, słodowe, lekko wodniste, mokry karton, goryczka niska w kierunku średniej, wyraźna, karmelowa
Podniebienie: średnia pełnia, podobnie jak nagazowanie, pijalne

Sampled from a bottle from Beers of Europe. Clear amber colour with a creamy head. Rich malty aroma. The quality of this beer is apparent from the first taste which is well-balanced, rich and has a butterscotch-like sweetness. Great mouth-filling flavour and good carbonation. Pleasant mildly bitter, finish but overall a little sweet for my taste. A highly drinkable Polotmavy.
Bottle. Pours light amber, small white head. Aroma of malt, caramel. In taste lightly sweet, malty. Medium body, moderate carbonation, finish with herbal hops. Nice.
De geur is niet zo heel goed. De kleur donkerblond tegen het amber opaan. De smaak is ook niet zo goed. Geen aanrader.

Jasno bursztynowe, klarowne. Piana wysoka, opada powoli ale prawie do zera. Lekko oblepia szkło. Zapach mało intensywny ale świeży i przyjemny. Zbożowo karmelowy. Smak słodki. Jakby toffi. Lekko ściągające. Po ociepleniu bardziej goryczkowe i masełkowe.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Drank on tap in a post-apocalyptic pub at night during Brutal Assault Festival 2016. A rather classic beer with close to no surprise, but a very decent taste with a positively good aftertaste. I think I preferred the Primator 11° lezak compared to this one, but maybe i wasnt in the best conditions to appreciate this one too, if you know what i mean...! Still a cool drink, best served cold obviously. APPROVED BY TAVERNYS BLACK METAL CREW!
UPDATED: AUG 12, 2016 Caña en Festival cerveza Avilés 11..08..2016. (r166).  Color ámbar miel oscuro turbio poca espuma blanca. Sabores maltosos ligeros afrutados y algún herbaceo. Normal.

Bottle. Color: Orangish golden. Off white head. Taste: Complex. Medium sweet and lightly bitter, hints of caramel, yeast, toast, alcohol, caramel and nuts. No pronounced flavors, but all together a pretty nice beer.

Zapach średnio intensywny, słód, karmel, toffi, cukier, przyprawy. Kolor brązowy, klarowne. Piana średnio obfita, drobna, średnio trwała. W smaku słodkie, średnia pełnia, słód, karmel, chleb, przyprawy, cukier. Goryczka niska, wysycenie średnie.

Bottle from a bottle shop. Golden color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, malts, earthy notes, toast, a bit of hops and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, malts, toast, earthy notes and grass. Good brew.

0,5l bottle. Clear copper colour with quickly disappearig white head. Aroma: Honey and caramel with yeasty notes. Taste: Sweet start with medium bitter mouthfeel. Has some sour tone but overall the bitterness dominates. Light body with fizzy carbonation. Medium lasting bitter finish.
Finom gránát sör, kicsit fémes ízzel, nem tartós habbal és talán egy picit kevés komlóval.

(Keg at Soldaten Svejk, 20160324) I hope this is the beer I had. The waitress serving me was not able to help in identifying. The beer poured brown and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had grass and caramel. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were grass, malts, caramel and bitterness. Aftertaste was bitter and mildly sweetness. A decent sweetish beer.

Kolor ciemnego bursztynu, klarowne. Piana obfita, drobna, beżowa. 
W aromacie słodkawe, lekki karmel. W smaku wyraźna goryczka od ciemnych słodów. 
Nuty palonego karmelu. Potem wychodzi lekko metaliczny aromat i smak.
Lekko wodniste w smaku. Typowy czeski polotmavý. 
Nawet nieźle smakuje.
Bottle 500ml. Price 1,19. Labai grai spalva, neilgai iliekanti, puta. Geras skonis, lengvai geriasi..

Kolejny czeski Primator, którego postanowiłem spróbować. Tym razem jest to "trzynastka". Wyglądu im nie można odmówić - bursztynowy kolor, idealnie klarowne, spora biała piana... Jak z obrazka. W zapachu już jest nieco gorzej - słód, karmel i trochę gwoździ. W smaku niestety najsłabiej - słodowo-karmelowe nuty podkreślone wspomnianym gwoździami. Zupełnie zabrakło goryczki. Wysycenie średnie. Piwo lekko wodniste. Słabo.
Caramel, coffee, nuts, toast, roasty, dough, barnyard, basement aromas, leather, earthy, leaves, butterscotch, licorice, licorice, licorice

Amber colour, perfect dense creamy head. Stays. Aroma of toast, candy, minimal roastiness, a hayish lager note. Light to medium body. Thin to oily texture. The flavour is richly malty. Toast, bread, candy, some wine. Light bitterness growing through the ending to the hoppy aftertaste. Quite good.

0,5l bottle from Elysium. Aroma: Caramel, malty, light fruit, lightly spiciness, medium intensive, metal (skin test confirmed). Apperance: Color is amber, clear, head is high and dense, not very durable, some lacing. Taste: Caramelly notes with some herbal hoppiness, malts, medium-low lingering herbal bitterness with time gets stronger, minimal metal, bread. Palate: Finish is semi-dry with some bitterness, carbonation is high to medium, body is medium-low.
500ml bottle in Kaliningrad (May 2013). Pours copper with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, grain, caramel. Taste is medium sweet, malts, caramel, burnt sugar.

500ml bottle from Dram Shop, Walkley - Deep amber copper coloured body topped by a creamy off white head that lasts well. Toasty and bready in the nose with some dark fruity esters. Slight bitterness balances out the bready malt sweetness. My first Polotmavý and not bad either, felt pretty much like a lighter version of the Doppelbock I had earlier today.
Bottle 500 ml. Aroma: bread and sweet malt, a little dried fruit and raisins. Taste: malty, full-bodied, a little caramel and bread, a little hop bitterness in finish. Good beer.
Clear, dark amber colour, medium white head. Weak aroma of malts and herbs. Quite bitter taste at first, then a cookie malltiness. Weak to medium body. Alright beer.

The taste is quite rich malty, with caramel notes and floral notes. Body average density. The finish is relatively short, punched him in the notes of burnt sugar and cocoa, with a slightly spicy hop bitterness of medium strength. Carbonation average, falls slowly. It is drunk with relative ease.
On tap in "Pub 64". Nice amber color. Aroma caramel, malts, herbs. Taste sweeter with fruits like apricot, then some herbs and a little hoppy end. Not bad one.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2015 Warka 05/01/2016. W aromacie trochę pieczywa razowego na miodzie, trochę karmelu, nuty metalu (jakby odległy zapach szlifierki kątowej podczas gładzenia spawu). W smaku zdecydowanie słodowe z bardzo niską goryczką. Zbyt wodniste bym mógł je nazwać pijalnym.
Nagyszerű sör, melyben egyaránt felfedezhető a karamellás édesség és a zateci komló keserűsége, mindez pompás egyensúlyban.
Fľaa 0,5 l z 1. pivotéky v Nitre. Tmavia farba, nahnedlá jemná pena, sladovo karamelová aróma. Stredná rezkosť, jemne nasládlé, karamel, slad, na konci trochu horké. Chutné polotmavé pivo.

Bottle 0,5l; very little hazy amber body, medium white head. Aroma of apples and caramel, malty. Taste is semi-sweet, bitter finish. Nice malty body is disturbing by wrong rush hops. Apples, apricot, malt, herbs. Medium body and carbonation. Not bad.

Bottle 0,5l. Almost clear, amber colored beer. Pleasant aroma of caramel, toasted malts, apples, apricots, honey. Flavor of toasted malts and fruits, little bit sweet, medium bodied, moderately bitter.  Not bad, but nothing special.

Bottle. Dram Shop, Sheffield. Clear, dark copper colour. Thick, foamy, lasting, cream coloured head. Aroma of sweet nuts. Dark honey. Light, metallic hop. Taste is honey sweet. Develops a bitterness, that lingers. Palate is airy, and massaging. The bitterness takes over any sweetness, toward the end. Liked this.
500ml bottle from premium Czech beers online. Pours clear amber with a thin off-white head. Aromas of honey, herbs, metal. Taste is sweet, malty. Sweet finish.
Ljubljanski Festival Piva 2015. Amber... caramel aroma, dogfood? Same taste, soapy, caramel, slightly dry. OK amber lager, just OK.

500 ml bottle @ Prague, originally rated 2015-04-20
Clear amber colored beer with beige creamy head leaving lacing. Aroma, flavor and aftertaste have herbs, earth, bread, toffee and dried fruits. Palate is medium full, slick, soft and foamy. Decent, but I dont see why polotmavy has to be a distinct style.

grain, caramel, grass; medium bitterness, light+ sweetness, medium body, rather thin but not watery feel, average carbonation, long bitter finish
Overall: drinkable, without bigger flaws, but nothing special

Podane/Served: 2015.03.20, Pint, 10°C
 Partia/Batch: 05.01.16, 0,5l Bottle
Aromat/Aroma: 
Słodowy, chlebowy, karmelowy, chmielowy.
 / Malts, bread, caramel, hops.
Wygląd/Appearance: 
Głęboki miedziany, klarowny. Piana puszysta, drobna. Średnio trwała.
 / Deep copper, clear. Fluffy, tiny head. Average lasting.
Smak/Taste: 
Ostry, słodowy, chlebowy, metaliczny.
 / Sharp, malts, bread, metallic.
Odczucie/Palate: 
Średnia pełnia, wysycenie w stronę wysokiego. Metaliczny posmak.
 / Medium body, carbonation towards high. Metalic aftertaste.
Ogólnie/Overall: 
Ciężkawe.
 / A bit heavy.
Nie wiem co napisać. To pierwsze piwo w tym gatunku i nie wiem co myśleć. Aromat słodowy, klarowne, piana trwała, a w smaku lekko metaliczne. To nie do końca to co tygryski lubią najbardziej...

WYGLĄD: Barwa miedziana, opalizujące. Piana drobna, obfita, dość długa. Ładnie zdobi szkło (lacing).
AROMAT: Aromat słodowy, chlebowy, karmel - ale właściwe to "krówka" (lekki diacetyl), łodygowość.
SMAK: Analogicznie do zapachu, czyli słody, "krówka" i chlebowość. Wysycenie średnie. goryczka niska.
OGÓLNIE: Zarówno w aromacie, jak i smaku występuje diacetyl, który akurat w tym piwie nie przeszkadza.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, nuts
Appearance-amber, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-lightly bitter, light sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-light body, slick feel, average carbonation, bitter finish
Overall-very refreshing

Bottle, pours copper colour, clear with stable off-white head. Metalic aroma, with some caramel and butter notes. Metal also in taste with delicate malty caramel background. Light bitterness. Fizy carbonation, light body, metalic aftertaste.

Courtesy of Jaghana
Couleur ambrée, mousse qui disparait. Nez doux caramel et paille. Gout caramel avec houblon gras et épicé, doux et rond en bouche. Longue fin de bouche caramel et épices.

Bottle 50cl, kindly given by Dominique. A clear copper amber beer with low head. Nose is on caramel, almond and light spices. Aroma is on caramel, grain, grassy hops, round body, sweet, toffee, very nice malty finish with good duration. Well hoped too, grassy, light resin, toasted caramel and light burnt caramel, nutty, nice !

Láhev 500 ml. Aroma je příjemně svěí, sladové s kvasnicovým, vybízející k napití. Pěna je zlato bílá, jemná, vysoká a drící. Barva samotného piva je jiskrná měděná. Chuť je svěí kvasnicová s ovocným nádechem a sladovým podkladem, fini je slabě hořký, spíe kvasnicový a drící. V ústech pivo působí plně, ale přesto lehce, má střední říz a je dobře pitelné. Jedná se o velmi dobrý, osvěující polotmavý leák.

Clear dark amber colour, 1.5 inches of yellowish off-white head; aroma of toffee, roasted nuts, toast, some dried fruity notes and herbal hops; taste is less complex: roasted nuts and malts as well as some herbal notes; correct polotmavy

Aroma di lievito e malto tostato. Gusto leggermente amarognolo con sentori di malto tostato e note mielose dolcine. Buon corpo ed equilibrio azzeccato ottima birra. 

---Rated BY Italianbeer85
330ml bottle from BePLUS, Xiamen. Pours golden brown with a dissipating white head. Aroma of malt and candy sugar. Dry edge to the taste. Bitter sweet finish.

Aromat karmelowy, troszkę owoców, jest żelazo, jest słodowść. Kolor ciemny róż, jasny bursztyn, piana szybko się redukuje, słabo zdobi szkło. Klarowne. Smak lekko kwaskowy, owocowy, słodowy, goryczka niska. Dobrze wysycone, goryczka nie zalega, dość mocno pijalne. Ogólnie bez wodotrysków, ale całkiem przyjemne.
On tap at Lokal. Pours deep golden color, white head. Aroma is full of caramel, nuts, malty. Taste is medium sweet, caramel, nuts, malty.

How: Draught.
Where: Soldaten Sveijk, Stockholm.
Appearance: Light amber colour with a large white head.
Aroma: Vegetables, hops, citrus.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, hops, metallic, grain, some bitterness.
On-tap at Beers 2014. Clear amber-brown. Aroma and taste - malts, caramel, honey, cookies, sweetish with light fruity notes, low bitterness. Light-medium bodied. OK.
At Beers 2014 Israel, Pours dark brown with beige head, aroma of caramel, toasted bread, cookies, flavor is sour bread, cookies, dark bread, medium bodied.

Clear, dark amber colour. Frothy and medium lasting white head. Intense aroma of malt and caramel with hints of hops. Medium bitterness, moderate sweetness. Taste is malty. Medium carbonation. Short, bitter finish. Decent Polotmavy.

Niestety albo trafiło mi się ze skazą, albo zawsze smakuje żelazem... a to nic przyjemnego w piwie :( spodziewałam się czegoś lepszego, gdyby nie posmak metaliczny, to byłoby dość lekkie piwo i nie najgorsze :)

500 ml bottle. BB 20/05/15. From the brewery in Náchod, Czech Republic. 
Clear coppery amber colour with a mid-size frothy foamy off-white head.
Dry wood, pencil, mild diacetyl sweetness and malt in the aroma. Not bad.
The flavour is dry woody malt with mild bitterness. Quite nice.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tapped at Lokal in Bratislava/Slovakia. Caramel, sweet honey and mild roasted malt aroma. Dark ruby copper color, thick two inch off white head. Taste is caramel, honey, roasted malt with a nice hoppy finish. Overall a great semi dark lager in its category.
500 ml, bottle. W aromacie chmielowe i słodowe. Lekko słodkie, karmelowe. Jednak z pewnym aromatem jakby starego chmielu lub taki stęchły.

Butelka. Barwa bursztynowa, piana bujna ale szybko opada. W aromacie jest słodowo, karmelowo rześko. Smak przede wszystkim słodowy z delikatnymi nutami karmelowymi. Goryczka na średnim poziomie, długa. Piwo jest rześkie i dobrze pijalne.

500ml Bottle from Hyberniska Mini-Market, Prague, Czech Repbulic (45Czk):
Sweet malts & caramel with faint alcohol & some brown sugar. There is some bread & toasted malts coming through & the beer is about medium strength with a good balance.
Clear, caramel amber with a thin & patchy white head that is slightly soapy.
Sweet malts feature heavily, along with some caramel and brown sugar. A few subtle hops & some spice feature too along with a slightly fruity base to it & some marzipan from the middle on.
Light-medium & smooth, sweet too with some alcohol being present although the taste is quite clean and wet throughout.

Sweet & malty, almost like a doppelbock in some respects. While the beer wasnt exactly anything special, it is still a drink that I wouldnt mind having again.

Aroma: roasted malts, caramel, wheat.
Appearance: amber-ruby color, nice white head.
Taste: low/medium bitterness, roasted malts, caramel, sweetness and honey.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, nice bitter finish.
Overall: Not so bad, but nothing outstanding.

500ml bottle. Clear mahogany color. Medium size, thick white head, stays. Looks good. Caramel, metallic, grainy and bit of sourness in aroma. Sweet, caramel, mild toffee, sense of burnt sugar and some grassy elements in taste. Hay-like bitterness in aftertaste.

0.5L bottle. Dark amber, no head. Interesting beer. First experience and it seems good. Caramel, roast and hops aroma. Light sour, overcooked sugar, some interesting floral games. Lemon seed and little honey in the end. Nice bitter mouth feel after drinking.

Bottle. Dark amber body with a minimal head that soon disappears completely. Aroma has hops, almonds and caramel. Thick, almost oily mouthfeel. Sweet caramelly taste with syrup and almonds - somewhat doppelbocky but of course without the bitter roast. Finish is more ale-like with caramelly hops.
Interesting new style for me--I prefer the dark lager to the hoppy hybrid that this apparently is, but the rich palate and carbonation are admirable enough
Flasche 50cl. Tschechisches Halbdunkles mit interessanten Malztönen. Es fehlt die sonst auftauchende fruchtig-weinige Note. Sehr gut.
Bottled. A brown beer with an amber beige head. The aroma has notes of malt and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, and caramel, leading to a bitter finish.

0,5L bottle. Pours clear amber with big white head. The head stays. Aroma: metallic, malty, slight sourness. Taste follows the nose, but also adds strong caramel, sweetness and noticeable bitterness. Alcohol is also slightly noticeable. The finish is surprisingly long bitter. Overall: surprisingly good, was expecting less.

Rødgylden klar skum råhvid tæt lang 
Nødde malt citrus metal 
Bitter moderat sød lidt
Vandede livlig 
@home

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear amber, small diminishing beige head. Malty, sweet, slight diacetyl in the aroma. Taste is malts, some caramel sweetness, light spice. Hops and light spice in the finish. Lingering caramel. Thin to medium body, watery to oily palate, soft carbonation.
Bottle. Pours clear light amber with thick light yellow head. Aroma is malty, metallic, candy. Flavor is malty, metallic, slightly spicy and hoppy.

0,5l bottle from Czech Republic. Clear, light amber colored beer with small, white haed. Caramel and malt odor. Intensive, caramel and malt aroma. Its a bit alcoholly. Some hop flavour also appears. Balanced, but the alcohol and caramel flavours are more intensive, than in the lighter Primator. Medium sweet taste. Slick texture, madium to full body, average carbonation. Sweet, caramel finish. Intensive, but balanced beer, delicious one.
Sample at DØE 2013. Clear orage colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, malt, caramel and bready notes.

500 ml bottle courtesy of Cuso. Thanks. Pours a translucent amber color with medium off-white head that soon dissipates away with an audible hiss. The aroma is sweet malts, caramel, hay and earthy hops. The taste is caramel malts forward with a nice spicy/earthy hop presence that balances the malts quite nicely. The palate is silky smooth with lively carbonation. Finishes medium in duration and dry. Overall: A decent beer and by far the hopiest polotmavy Ive tried so far.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear reddish amber with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are caramel, malt, and hay  with a slightly dry finish.

Tap at RJ. Aroma caramel, light coffee. Average. Clear amber colour. Stable yellowish head. Taste is mostly malty. Caramel, lightly coffee. Towards the finish it gains moderate ambiguous bitterness. Overall an average beer, good amongst industrials.
Bottled ; Pilsen ; CZ ; Malt,caramel and buttery aroma ; Clear amber color with smaller lasting head ; Heavy sweet taste with longer finish ; Medium body ; Soft carbon ; Fairly good amber.

BOTTLE.

Head: beige, medium, frothy to creamy, avg. retention. Colour: copper, clear.

Aroma: caramel.

Taste: caramel, medium bitterness.

Nothing extraordinary, just a good amber.

Bottle at Ølfestival 2013.
Clear orange-red coloured with a small white head.
Sweet and malty aroma of caramel, bread and hops.
Malty flavour of caramel, bread and hops.
Hoppy finish.

A - Crystal clear amber in color. A tight knit cream colored head that holds up very well. Thick sheets of lacing with a thick ceiling of micro-bubbles. A mix of full sheets and spiderweb patterns of lacing.

S - Sweet malt with a touch of toasted cereal grain. Floral honey, brown sugar, grassy hops.

T - Saaz hops hits right away along with a sweet malt with honey and flowers in the background. Dusty lager yeast marries with the grassy hops and create a solid edge to balance out the sweet malt. Finishes sweet before quickly turning dry.

M - Heavy medium body, great flowy carbonation.

Great looking beer. Just what youd expect from a Czech Marzen. Great malt profile with plenty of noble hops to balance it out. Very satisfying.

Serving type: bottle

11-19-2011

Draught at Svejk, Stockholm.
Thick lasting beige head. Clear amber color. After looking so good I was attacked by a huge butter scotch aroma and a slightly metalic taste with far to much roasted tastes for a light Tjeck lager. Some reisdual sweetness and medium body.

Dunkles Bernstein, feinporiger Schaum mittlerer Dauer. Karamell, Fudge, Toast, leicht röstig. Halbtrockener, vollmundiger Antrunk. Die Würze des Malzes ist auffallend und lecker zugleich, auch buttrige Aromen sind zu schmecken. Bittert schön lang nach. Gutes Bernstein/Halbdunkles!
Bottle. Pours clear amber with airy white head. Clear aroma of hops and malt with a touch of caramel. Bitter, hoppy onset, medium mody, characterised by subtle caramel notes, bitter finish. OK
Bottle from Salling, Aarhus. Clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and bready. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 240313
Bottle. Clear deep amber/red with small tan head. Aroma is malt, fruit and caramel. Flavour is malt, caramel, medium sweet, little bread, hop and medium bitter.
Clear amber colour, aroma of roasted dark bread and caramel, flavour of dark bread with some caramel notes,  little bitterness.
Postupně sem budu doplňopvat piva, co jsem vypil a zapsal si, chvilku to asi bude trvat a proto k těm dříve vypitým pivům nebudou ádné "dojmy" .

Espuma: No muy abundante, jabonosa y efímera pero dejando una corona de espuma con burbujas que suben en rosario.

Color: Cobre, muy trasparente, limpia y brillante, con brillos dorados y naranjas.

Intensidad aromática: Alta.

Aroma: Malta, caramelo, toffee, miel, especias, herbal, afrutada (albaricoque), membrillo.

Entrada en boca/amargor: Muy dulce con un regusto amargo, que apenas dura con toque metálico. No es ácida.

Sabor: Malta, caramelo, fruta (albaricoque), membrillo, miel, ciruela claudia.

Draught, clear deep amber colour with reddish taints, aroma of dark bread  and caramel, flavour of dark bread with some fruitiness, quite sweet with a little bitterness and some sourness. drinkable but not too good.
Pours cloudy amber with minimal, quickly dissipating head. Aroma has notes of wheat and toasted malt. Taste has wheat, toasted malt, and lemon notes. Overall an easy drinker.

Bottle. The aroma reminded me of their English Pale Ale, only less fruity and more sharp. caramel, butter, toffee and some hops. Tastewise this is one bitter beer with the toasted malts unable to balance the bitterness despite the moderately substantial body. A bit amateurish so to speak but likeable.
En klassisk tjeckisk öl. Skiljer sig ganska lite från en vanlig Primator. Färgen lite mer åt kopparhållet och lite smak av rostat bröd. Annars en klassisk maltighet och smörkola.

Draught at the Norma Jean Tel Aviv. Clear dark amber colour, with a frothy white head. Sweet, Czech hops aroma. Tastes sweet and buttery and a little sour. Buttery aftertaste, light body, soft carbonation. Eh.

Draught at Norma Jean in Tel Aviv. As "Primator Semi-dark". Clear reddish amber color. Aroma of loits of butter, some malt and toasted notes. Sweetish flavor with malt, butter, caramel and a slightly bitter finish. Light to medium-bodied. Not so good.

Amber coloured and clear. Has a white head, mostly lasting. Looks good. Aroma is malty, sweet, notes of butter. Flavor sweet too. Some fatty notes, faint bitter finish. Creamy texture and lively carbonation.
butter roasty, golden, off white foam,clear, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, soft carbonation, bitter,

Barva: jantarová, tmavá, průhledná. Pěna: světle nahnědlá, středně hustá, vysoká. Vůně: sladově karamelová s kouřovou stopou. Chuť: vyváená sladově chmelové se středně dlouhým hořkým dozvukem. Plné a vyváené pivo středně a mírně hořké.

04.04.2012. 0,5l Bottle. Thanks to Gunnar!! Amber brown colour with white head. Malty aroma with notes of mal tsweetness. A little watery mouthfeel gives a rather flat aftertaste. Moderate body, smooth and very soft bitter aftertaste.

earthy, floral, cereal, butterscotch, vanilla, cooked vegetables, amber, cloudy, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter, long finish,
Bottle.Copper colour with medium white head.Aroma is strong malty and flavor of caramel and tosted bread,well balanced and spicey finish.
Clear amber color with fine white head. Sweet aroma. A good Czech beer that tastes like a really good (classic), slightly sharp in taste. Purchased in prague 2007
olor a malta y muy agradable tambien al paladar, algo de aroma poco lupulo,  una cerveza muy buena
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text: Bottle from supermarket in Bratislava. Amber colro with medium white head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel. Taste, caramel, honey, roasted malt, hints of toasted bread. Bittersweet finish. Drinkable.
A clear amber beer with a creamy white head. Aroma is malty, notes of caramel. Taste is malty and yeaty, toffee notes. Sweet with light bitterness.

Voldby market, DK.
Bottle, 270811.
Golden with White head. Aroma of malt. Flavour with some hops.
Bottle @ Home. Pours dark brown with a offwhite head. Aroma of malt, caramel, light grassy hops. Taste is malt, caramel, grainy hops. Thin to medium body, soft carbonation. 040811

Draught at the 4th Czeh Beerfestival, Bp.
Clear copper colour with a medium sized, off-white head, which leaves a thin film behind.
Sweet-sourish nose.
Medium sharp start followed by a fruity aroma with caramel, dough and grassy hops.
The sweetish flavour is balanced in the end by citrus and spices, which remains in a medium kinded aftertaste.
An easy drinakble, adequately balanced vienna.
Amber-reddish colour with tan head. Aroma of butter with malt and a bit of caramel. Very balanced flavour, not too sweet or bitter. Not a disappointing one.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2012 Pours a nice amber colour with a white head. Aroma is sweet malty caramel. Taste is malty and buttery with notes of caramel. The finish is quite a nice medium dry hop bitterness. Nice one

Leicht herber Antrunk, dann setzt das Malz ein, mild, aber nachdrücklich und mit dezenter Süße. Hintergründig wird es etwas röstmalzig, das Bier bleibt leicht Süße und wird hopfiger, was sich aber in Grenzen hält. Dazu wird das Bier im Mittelteil auch herber, mit dem soliden Malzgrundton bildet es das Hauptaroma. Im nachgeschmack weiter röstmalzig-süß, dazu deutlich hopfig als bisher. Angenehm. 	 
Test vom 8.1.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 10,10,12,11,11,11 - 10,90

IV. Cseh sörnapok, Budapest. Kissé narancsos vörösesbarna színű, habja enyhén krémes és piszkosfehér, egészen kitartó. Illata édeskés, maláta krumplicukor és karamella érződik. Egészen testes és ízes mégis nagyon könnyedén lehet inni, ízjegyei hasonlóak, még lágy gyümölcsösség érződik, valamint friss füves komlós keserűség lép életbe. Nekem nagyon ízlett, remek sör.

On tap at Piwoteka Narodowa, opening day. Nice ecru head, very clear medium brown color. Smells like dusty flowers and herbs. Tastes moderately sweet, very low bitterness, slight caramel. Boring but a repeat beer in an emergency (but it is hard to keep these Primators separate there are so many varieties).
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: 500 ml bottle, ABV is 5.5%. Might be imported to Norway. Amber colour, big head, slightly off-white. Strong aroma of butterscotch and caramel. Fresh and soft mouthfeel, just the right carbonation in the glass. The flavour has also butterscotch (too much) and caramel. Some hops in the finish.

(Bottle, Monks Café Sveavägen, Stockholm) Amber colour with lasting, frothy, beige head. Malty nose with notes of toast, cereal, bread and orange peel. Malty, slightly roasted taste with bread, toast, orange peel and a mild, spicy bitterness in the finish. Medium body, slightly sweetish. Quite nice.
Bottled. Bought in my parents village grocery shop. This ones surprisingly good.

0,5 l bottle as a gift.
Clear amber-reddish colored beer with a small but stable, creamy off white-tan head. Sweet malt and toasted caramel in the aroma with a moderated herbal hop perfume. Medium bodied beer with caramel and malt, toasted tastes, sourish yeasts and a dry, herbal hop in the finish. Not a bad but not a very exciting one...
500 ml bottle at home from Kaufland. Amber colour, sweet aroma and taste, good semi-dark beer for a nice price. ( Jantárová farba, sladká vôňa a chuť, dobré polotmavé pivo za výbornú cenu. )
I have had a bottle of this in fridge for awhile, dodging it actually, but was pleasantly surprised that it drank so easily. Nothing fancy but smooth drinking with light toffee notes.

Bottled. Nice Amber coloration that start with a huge beige head and keep perfect lace until end it. Aroma is sweety, notes of toasted malt, caramel, and some hop. Flavor is a balanced bitterness and sweetness more sweet than bitter, but notes of alcohol on it. Mouthfeel has a medium duration but a good beer after a stressing day! I love it.

Bottle. Clear orangeish amber pour with a dense beige head that lasts a while. Aroma of biscuity malt, toast and caramel. The flavour mirrorrs the aroma with an initial hint of sweetness on the front palate followed by lingering bitterness on the back. Nice sessionable Vienna, on the heavy side for the style but still good.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2010 500ml bottle. Amber, light beige head. Aroma of rich caramel, a bit of toast, touches of earth and grass. Taste has caramel, but its not all that sweet. Hazelnuts and some dry sherry. A little sourness. Quite pronounced bitterness at the finish features some metal. Not really my sort of thing but rather good. [3.1]Trying again, this time on purpose. I bought the one above expecting a pilsener (ignorant as I am). Then I bought another by accident, enjoyed it rather more and was surprised to later look at my rating (the descriptions OK, the scores not). This is lovely: a balanced, tasty and gluggable drop.

bottle. Dark reddish brown. Aroma hardly noticebly but some vanilla and raisins. Brown frothy head that disappears quickly. Quite sweet taste with some soy and roasty malt. That typical lager sourness. Ok for a lager.

Bottle, 5.5%. Quite malty aroma, a little syrupy. Clear grey amber colour. Big stable off-white head. The flavour is quite malty with a very faint aniseed note, hint of liquorice. The flavour lets on that there is more than 5.5% ABV. Low bitterness, but enough to balance the malt. Good body. Slightly low carbonation, very pleasant.

Bottle @ Billa, Prague. Pours clear amber with a small lasting creamy white head. Nose is sweet of butter, toffee and buiscuit. Taste is sweet malty buiscuit with a fair amount of hops in the end. Ends dry. Medium and smooth body. Classic for its style I think!

Draught at Soldaten Svejk in Stockholm. It poured a clear dark golden liquid with a medium sized light brown foam that left a nice lacing. Weak smell of caramell and amalt. Smooth mouthfeel. Taste of malt, burned toast and lots of caramell. I didnt enjoy this beer very much, way to much caramell and it had another taste that didnt fit me.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2011 (Bottle 0,5l)
Sweet, fresh and fruity, light citrusy, grass aroma. Clear amber-red color. Medium creamy white head. Light sweet, light dusty. Fizzy. Bitter finish. Sticky texture.

Large, creamy, off-white intial head. Excellent lacing. Sparkling, amber body. Aroma: moderate malty, caramel, moderate hoppy and honey.Initial flavor: light sweetness and bitterness. Final flavor: heavy bitterness and light sweetness. Long duration. Hoppy bitterness.  Palate: light-medium body, dry texture, lively/soft carbonation and heavy astringent finish. 85s

50 cl bottle from Pivni Galerie, Prague. BB 10.02.10. Sampled on July 17, 2009Clear copper color, big fluffy teal head. Sweet, malty, alcohol scent, also some butter. Metallic, sweet, butter, alcohol taste. Medium mouthfeel, grainy bitterness. Alcohol aftertaste.
Bottle. Pours deep amber with a small off white head. Aroma of malt.Roasty light flavour, yeasty as well, caramel, easy bitterness
Bottle. Light buttered bread nose. Amber, golden lacing head. Medium body, fruity, berrylike base, herbal light earthy hops, slightly buttery caramel. Copperpipe aftertaste.

Sötet borostyan szinü ital terjedelmes de hamar zsugorodo habbal.Illata edeskes,bogyos gyümölcsös.Ize is gyümölcsös,karamellas de nem edes!Inkább a komlo keserüje erzödik rajta.Az alkohol is elege kierzödik belöle,talan az ad neki egy kis edesseget.Közepes teste van,eleg sok szensavval köritve.Utóize kesernyes,szaraz.
500 ml bottle. Amber color, off-white head. Malty aroma, bitter herbal flavor. Medium body, high carbonation.

Bottle from Tesco, Prague. Deep amber in colour with a moderate white head and decent carbonation. Malt aroma with a touch of red fruit. Flavour started sweet, before some doughy malt, a hint of spice and a decent bitter finish. Good.

Pours dark brown copper with a decent creamy beige head. Light malty aroma with hints of butter, soap and yeast. Lightly roasted flavor of caramel malt and a hint of coffe, finishing with a touch of hop-bitterness.

Deep chestnut-amber colour, small amberish head. (Rain)watery nose, with quite some caramle, leafy, hot hops. Bitterish, leafy taste with less caramel than the nose; even a touch of hops at the end. A bit watery feel, but not really empty. Starts hesitatingly, but turns out to be a pretty decent beer.

(draught, at the Pivni Galerie, Prague) light hazy copperish-red colour, creamy off-white head. aroma has very light notes of peaches, floral hops, citrus and grain. flavour is peaches, shy roasted pale malts, light hops. light diacetyl in both. medium carbonation and body, light bitter finish.
caramel aroma,amber, lightly bitter, medium sweetness, medium body, bitter, good halfdark beer
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottled. Amber colour with mediumsized creamy head that leaves nice lace. Aroma is malty, yeasty, quite caramelly with some slight very sweet notes. Flavour is caramel malts, sugar, some mild yeastyness as well as finnishing in a nice smooth bitterness mixed with toffee.

Quite well performed drama of mixture of Pils and Dunkel, aromatic hop and caramelic notes form the dunkel, flavour is balanced, very drinkable, moderate sweet, medium bodied, some wooden notes as well

Bottle @<a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/forums/cnudde-ølsmagn  target=_new> Cnudde Tasting.. Clear medium amber color with a average, creamy - frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to beige head. Aroma is moderate malty and yeasty, toffee, butter, light brown sugar. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and light bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. (290308)

(Bottle 50 cl) Courtesy of yespr. Clear, amber golden with a neat, off-white head. sweetish caramel aroma with a touch of butter. Medium body with light caramel notes - and again a touch of butter. Short, dry, lightly hoppy finish. 290308
Clear amber with medium white short lasting head. Sweet malty aroma with caramel and brewing cereal notes. Sweet flavor with malty and caramel notes. A bit skunky.

The Fonefan/Brugmansia Cnudde tasting. Courtesy of  Yespr. The color is like liquid amber - very beautiful! The aroma has notes of malt, caramel and straw. The flavour is sweet with notes of malt, caramel straw and the finish is dry with hints of citrus.
Bottle. Small head with medium duration. Color is brown. Aroma and taste are caramel, malt and hops.
Dark golden beer with a lasting off-white head. Malty aroma with some caramel and  a hint of grass. Sweet and big flavour with a bitter finish.

50 cL [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> *//Brugmansias Cnudde tasting. Pours almost clear orange with a lacing white head. Spiced and butterish malt aroma. Flavour is sweet and light spiced. Malty and light butterish. Lingering spiced and dry bitter flavour into the finish. Light spiced in the far finish.
Bottle. High creamy and lasting off-white head. Clear dark brown body. Sweet caramel butter aroma. Sweet caramel flavor without much hops bitterness and a low carbonation. Long sweet aftertaste.

Bottle. Frothy white good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Moderate malty light hoppy week aroma. Light bitter and sweet flavor. Very caramellic/toffee-ic.
Watery palate.
Bottle. Clear amber colour with a huge beige head. Rich aroma and taste of roasted malts and caramel with a weak hoppy finish.

Bottle. Golden amberish colour with thin beige head. Sweet metallic aroma of roasted malts. Bitter sweet mouthfeel and also bitter and a bit sour/ sweet finish. At the end of the day, I doesn´t really like this half dark vienna.

bottle. Clear amber/brown colour, large head. Malty noise. Full-bodied, malty and caramelly flavours dominate. Not sweet, but pleasantly hoppy as well, with a good portion of Saaz hops. Slightly fruity as well. Very good.
No idea where I tasted this or how or with whom but my notes read, ..rich buttery vanilla malt and raisiny fruit. Raisin aroma. Beautiful bronze ringed with froth... Sounds alright.

Tap at Angleterre, Helsinki. Reddish orange, small lacy head. Nutty caramel, malty and fruity nose. Strange, but very tasty and full flavor. Malts, bitter hoppiness which Im not very familiar with and a tropical fruity tartness. Pretty messy and unappealing overall.

(Draught) Clear, darkish red-amber with a small head. Sweetish-caramely-malty aroma with some sourness. Sweet-sourish-caramely and moderately acidic, a bit fruity flavor. Light to medium-bodied with balanced, slightly sharp carbonation. A sweet and simple Czech brew.

Keg (Kittys, Helsinki)
Dark orange, thin head. Slightly sweet malty aroma - but you have to search for it. Sweet mellow malt, akin to red ales. Nutty in places. Fun interesting lager, much more character than light ones, but still  just a lager.

Toasty and bready malts are strong in the nose with some dark fruity esters.  Light haze to the deep amber copper coloured body topped by a creamy, fine bubbled, sticky off white head that lasts well.  Assertive bitterness matches well to the intense bready malt sweetness.  Medium body with strong, fine bubbled effervescence that really opens up the palate.  Tulip glass.  Just above fridge temperature.  Bottle (BB 09/05/08, Brewery Creek, Sep-07).

bottle from BOM club.  pours an amber with a decent head.  not much aroma to talk about, just pretty generic.  a decent beer, not great, not terrible.  easily drinkable, although a bit off on the finish.
Reddish amber colour with nice head.  Aroma is caramel malts and some tart plums.  Lots of malt and caramel with great balance.  Nicer then the overly sweet higher abv primators.

Bottle, Brewery CreekBright brick red, great loose head.  Rich nose of caramel, toast and a complex dusty, fruity yeast note.  Crisp and clean on the palate with earth, toast, caramel...the complex simplicity of the finest East Van pho.  This lagers brilliance really creeps up as I work through the glass.
Bottle 0,5ltr bought in Karlovy Vary, Czech Rep: Amber looking beer from Nachod, Czech Rep. with some hints of caramel.
dark rusty red, strong head, not much aroma, but rich in taste. a pleasant beer.

Bottle:Dark red colour , flat head.
Aroma of lots of sweet sytetic maltynes.Thin body,short finish.

Bottle. Pours with an amber color. Aroma is more like that of an Pilsener, some musty notes and some malty notes. Flavor gets better when the beer warms up. It brings out some complexity then, with flavors of apricot, hops and dough. Body is medium, all in all not a bad beer.

12 oz bottle VIA Malt of The Earth Beer Club. Pours a clear amber with an average size beige head. I am not getting much aroma here, just some subtle slightly biscuity malts.Interesting flavors. Starts sweet but quickly turns bitter. I detect some toastiness, a tiny bit of chocolate malt, and some grassy/spicey hops in the crisp finish. A bit of a metallic aftertaste. Medium body. Medium carbonation.

Draught at Soldaten Svejk, Stockholm.  Clear amber, very rich creamy head. Aroma of caramel with a light touch of hay-like saaz hops. Medium bodied, lightly fruity, clean rounded mouthfeel. The body is very solid for a Czech beer, but then 13° beers are not that common. Also a bit low on personality, but I guess Pivovar Náchod has grown considerably lately. Finishes with medium bitterness. A more than decent effort that I am very willing to come back to.
bottled. copperish colour with a minimal head. lightly rusty aroma, rockmelon. light, lagery texture. quite fresh, semi-bitter with some faint milk chocolate. not bad for  nachod beer

Bottled(500ml). Nice dark amber coloured, medium sized creamy head. Toffee and herbal nose. Moderate sweet malty and caramel aroma with notes of toffee and vegetables. Very smooth with light bitter hoppy finish.
Bottled: Maly fresh aroma, sweetish. Amber color, creamy head. Malty flavor, toffee and caramel notes, some light bitter hop flavor. Dry and astringent.

[Draught at Svejk, STockholm, Sweden]
Amber. Large, creamy head.
Some toffee. Grassy with vegetable-notes.
Amber/deep golden, great white head. Hoppy aroma with vegetable notes. Hoppy fruity flavor and with a nice bitter finish.

Bottle: Clear, amber coloured, small lacing head, quickly diminishing to a small foamy layer; the aroma is a mix of dark sweet malt and toasted malt and an aromatic bitterness; moderate to strong sweet-bitter flavour, light bodied; first toasted malty, then bitter-sweet lingering finish. An interesting brew, that combines quite well the qualties of a Dunkel and a Bohemian Pils (Polotmavy means "half-dark"). Nice....
Dark amber color, medium light yellow head. Chocolate, toffee, sweetness and mild licorice in aroma. Medium bodied. Chocolate, hops and sweetness in flavor, aftertaste lasts with hops and chocolate.

Bottle at Sunday Times Wine Festival, London. On the bumpf this was down as a "semi-dark beer".  Not sure what that means.  Looked and tasted like a Vienna to me. However, I liked it.  Dark caramel/red colour with beige head.  Toffee/caramel aroma.  Fine in mouth, more caramel, finish is a bit sweet.  Not too much hop.  Good caramel/malt beer.
